name: Tuff’en Up
description:
Cybersecurity Game Jam ($4k+ prize pool)

Hosted by SecurityGames · #securitygames

Game name: Tuff’en Up

  • You just bought a new PC and are eager to get the latest software. You are not too tech-savvy, and have friends who are up-to-date with the latest cyber news. You begin to worry after hearing frightening stories of cyber attacks, ransomware, and malware. You seek guidance from a trending TV series on the UsTube Network called "Tuff'en Up". They offer the best tips and tricks to keep your machines (mobile/laptop/desktop) safe and secure during a turbulent era of viruses, phishing attacks, and security patches. Stay tuned for next week's latest episode. ~When the going gets rough, tuff’en up!
    • Episode 1: Snotty Intruders - COMPLETED
      • Play in a spaceship and do not allow any unidentified aircraft into the loading bay. Use your virus scanners to determine if visitors are safe and authorized for entry. Eliminate any unwelcome and dangerous aircraft, while keeping the safety and integrity of the loading bay intact.

-------

~ IN DEVELOPMENT ~

    • Episode 2: Something’s Phishy
      • Simulate an email desktop application called Inlook and learn to detect/protect against smelly phish who are demanding your attention. Go down into the dungeons of Inlook and find safe passage to the Phish Alert button, which will verify the type of phish and whether it is safe to keep.
    • Episode 3: Up, Up and not far Away
      • Keep your air balloon afloat and high enough with the other balloons. You don’t want to be at the bottom of the pack or you’ll miss out on the latest news from the chief balloon. Reunite with the others to feel safe and secure. Avoid incoming obstacles, such as viruses, hacker code and smelly phish raining from above.
  • Watch all 3 episodes and beat the minigames to learn how to better protect your new gaming PC!
